channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Tens of thousands of Singapore's migrant workers are infected. The rest are stuck in their dorms as the country opens up
item.description: At the start of April, Singapore had about 1,000 cases of the novel coronavirus.

item.title: Top health officials vanish from TV interviews as White House refocuses messaging
Witness: I'm a lifelong Republican; I'm embarrassed
item.description: Mike Bowen, a protective equipment manufacturer who warned about the lack of PPE, testified more lives will be lost if the US government doesn't listen to scientists.

item.title: Coronavirus has arrived in Bangladesh camps home to 1 million Rohingya refugees
Life after lockdown in Vietnam: This is what it's like when an entire country reopens
item.description: As the faint smell of smoke rose up from the sidewalk and into my bedroom, I jumped up and stepped out onto the balcony to survey the Hanoi streets.

item.title: 5 takeaways from ousted vaccine chief's testimony on Trump admin's coronavirus response
'We're in deep s***': Whistleblower recounts unforgettable email
item.description: Rick Bright, the ousted director of a federal vaccine agency, recalls a mask manufacturer's emailed warning about the lack of protective equipment amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Greta Thunberg: 'Our actions can be the difference between life and death for many others'
item.description: Teen activist Greta Thunberg is urging the world to listen to scientists as she describes the devastating impact the coronavirus pandemic is having around the world.

item.title: Sailors who had returned to virus-stricken aircraft carrier test positive
item.description: At least five sailors who had returned to the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier have tested positive for coronavirus despite extensive efforts by the US Navy to prevent another outbreak on the ship, according to a US defense official.

item.title: US military sends very public message to China as tensions rise in South China Sea
Coronavirus global death toll passes 300,000 as countries wait in lockdown
item.description: More than 300,000 people around the world have now died globally from the coronavirus, according to figures from Johns Hopkins University, as the pandemic passed yet another bleak milestone on Thursday.

item.title: Dr. Gupta reacts to whistleblower's revelation: 'That's pretty staggering'
item.description: Rick Bright, the ousted director of a vaccine agency, testified to Congress that he warned HHS about importing N95 masks because they do not offer healthcare workers as much protection as those manufactured in the US.

item.title: Church sues Zoom after 'zoombomber' streamed porn in Bible study class
item.description: A San Francisco church is suing Zoom after one of its bible study classes was allegedly infiltrated by a hacker who bombarded the video call with porn.

item.title: The pandemic is wreaking havoc on the entire world's mental health, UN warns
item.description: There is a "high prevalence" of mental distress in countries across the globe due to the coronavirus pandemic, especially among health care workers and children, according to the United Nations and the World Health Organization.

item.title: US Senate intelligence chairman steps down over FBI investigation
Joe Biden's likeliest running mates, ranked
item.description: Talk to anyone who knows anything about Joe Biden's vice presidential picking process and they'll all tell you the same thing: It's Sens. Kamala Harris (California) and Amy Klobuchar (Minnesota) -- and then everyone else.

item.title: Teen's CPR helps save 8-year-old brother with Covid-related illness
item.description: Jayden Hardowar was rescued by his 15-year-old brother's quick thinking after going into cardiac arrest at home, his family says, following what doctors told them was a coronavirus-related condition. CNN's Anderson Cooper speaks with Tyron Hardowar and his father Roup about the 8-year-old's ordeal.

item.title: Police examine CCTV footage of rail worker who died from Covid-19 after alleged spitting incident
item.description: Police are examining CCTV footage after a British transport worker died with coronavirus 14 days after being allegedly spat on in a busy London station.

item.title: Judge slams the brakes on William Barr's abuse of power
See iconic casino's unprecedented situation
item.description: CNN's Kyung Lah speaks with the CEO of Caesars Entertainment Tony Rodio about how the pandemic has halted operations at the iconic Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and how the hotel and casino plans to reopen once restrictions are eased.

item.title: Two NFL players are wanted for allegedly robbing partygoers at gunpoint
item.description: Police in southeast Florida have issued arrest warrants for two NFL players for armed robbery, according to the police department.

item.title: 'The full story' about Ahmaud Arbery's killing is yet to be revealed, suspect's attorneys say in first statement
Elon Musk is using his power to be selfish
McDonald's is going to look drastically different when it opens
item.description: When McDonald's restaurants reopen, customers should expect stickers on the floor encouraging social distancing and the closure of self-serve beverage bars. Workers wearing masks might check in with a thumbs up, or kindly ask you to move away from others.

item.title: Videos show skydivers spiraling in sky before crashing
item.description: Eyewitnesses in Florida captured two skydivers spinning in the sky before they crashed into a tree and landed in front of a home, according to police and firefighters in Titusville.

item.title: How much water do we really need to drink?
item.description: Here's some welcome news: Water can work wonders for your health.

item.title: Melissa Etheridge's son, Beckett Cypher, dies at 21
item.description: Beckett Cypher, the son of Melissa Etheridge and her former partner Julie Cypher, has died, a representative for the singer told CNN. He was 21.

item.title: Doctors make link between Covid-19 and rare 'Kawasaki-like' inflammatory disease in children
Russia being accused of undercounting Covid-19 deaths
item.description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports Russia's method of counting Covid-19 deaths have led to what critics call a suspiciously low number in Moscow.

item.title: Tens of thousands under lockdown evacuate as Typhoon Vongfong strikes Philippines
item.description: Typhoon Vongfong has made landfall in the Philippines, forcing the evacuation of tens of thousands of people in a country under lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Appeals court lets emoluments lawsuit against Trump proceed
item.description: An appeals court Thursday morning rejected an attempt by President Donald Trump to stop an emoluments lawsuit challenging his ownership of a hotel in Washington, DC.

item.title: Man arrested after allegedly shooting and stabbing multiple people in California rampage
item.description: A man has been arrested on suspicion of shooting and stabbing multiple people during a rampage through Rancho Cucamonga, California.

item.title: Fox News hosts target Dr. Fauci
item.description: After Dr. Anthony Fauci's Senate testimony, where he said the US doesn't have complete control over the coronavirus pandemic, Fox News hosts criticized him. CNN's Jim Acosta reports.

item.title: Weapons and explosives seized during police raid on elite German soldier's home
item.description: A stash of weapons, ammunition and explosives was seized at the home of an elite German soldier, officials have confirmed.

item.title: Why this movie has been playing for 24 years
item.description: "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" is an iconic part of Indian cinema, and has changed rom-coms forever. It's so beloved that it has screened every day, for more than 24 years, at the Maratha Mandir theater in Mumbai.

item.title: Massacre at maternity ward shows a chilling truth for women in Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan's "peace deal" has been blown up. The government has resumed fighting the Taliban after a horrifying attack by gunmen on a maternity ward run by Doctors Without Borders in Kabul. Mothers and nurses were the main victims in the first attack, with 16 killed. Two of the dead were newborns.

item.title: Hundreds of fossilized human footprints found in Africa could reveal ancient traditions
item.description: Hundreds of fossilized human footprints made between 5,760 and 19,100 years ago have been discovered in Africa, shedding light on what life was like in ancient communities, according to a new study. This represents the largest collection of fossilized footprints found in Africa to date.

item.title: UFC fighter says his teeth were falling out during brutal bout
item.description: He's watched countless bouts, but even UFC President Dana White found this one tough viewing.

item.title: How expensive will air travel be after the Covid-19 crisis?
item.description: When the state of Florida began enacting stay-at-home measures and closing beaches in mid-March, in response to the threat of Covid-19, Miami-based real estate agent and artist Nadia Bouzid was in the middle of painting a mural inside a new hotel in Cancun, Mexico.

item.title: Semitruck skids out of control and barely misses officers
item.description: Belton Police Department footage shows an 18-wheeler skidding out of control and barely missing officers on a Texas highway.

item.title: Demand for private islands is up as super rich seek an escape
item.description: While nearly all leisure travel remains paused because of the coronavirus pandemic, the demand for private islands is on the rise.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen's next move is to launch $1 million online chess tour
item.description: Magnus Carlsen, the chess superstar, is making a new move to boost the sport's popularity.

item.title: What eating in a restaurant may look like during the pandemic
item.description: Michelin-starred meals via delivery. Instagram Live cooking demos. Gourmet boxes from community supported agriculture.

item.title: Watch controlled explosion destroy 2 German cooling towers
item.description: A spectacular controlled explosion has demolished the two cooling towers of a disused nuclear power plant in southwestern Germany.

item.title: Elle Fanning dressed up as Brad Pitt and nailed it
item.description: Elle Fanning may have won the Doppelgänger Challenge.

item.title: Oscar-winning director on risking it all for the perfect shot
item.description: Having survived an avalanche and been tested in some of the most remote places on earth, Jimmy Chin knows what it's like to be at the mercy of mother nature.

item.title: Top health officials vanish from TV
item.description: • Analysis: Trump finally broke with Fauci

item.title: Fears rise of virus resurgence in China
Why Moscow didn't count 60% of suspected Covid-19 deaths
item.description: Moscow's health department hit back at media reports that it was underreporting Covid-19 fatalities, saying its data was "absolutely open," but acknowledging that it only counts deaths that were found through postmortem autopsy to have been caused directly by coronavirus complications.

item.title: 5 takeaways from whistleblower's testimony on US coronavirus response
item.description: • 'We're in deep s***': Rick Bright recounts unforgettable email • Opinion: Is Bright's apocalyptic warning right?
